column4: how can I reduce screen brightness ubuntu 10.10 on a Vaio VGN-CS27GJ
go to monitor settings or use buttons on your monitor if you have any
monitor settings(depending on vendor) are at system > preferences > monitors
is your graphics driver the latest version?
, It appears that your graphics driver does not support the necessary extensions to use this tool.  Do you want to use your graphics driver vendor's tool instead?
that takes me to nvidia control panel
I was able to run the Fn key with the F5 anf F6 buttons to change the settings
this isnt reducing the output of the screen, just changing the levels, I am actually worried about the excessive heat from the screen. Doesnt become so hot in windows
